channel.title: Very important...please help me
channel.description:
I have a linksys WAG54g and the wireless network is working perfectly.
The desktop computer is plugged into one of the physical ports.
When I plug a laptop into a physical port. The laptop displays [b]..Connecting, allocating an ip address.[/b][i] then[/i][b] Network cable unplugged.[/b]
The router has allocated an ip address.
It doesnt matter what port the desktop pc is plugged into - it works.
It doesnt matter what port the laptop is plugged into - it doesn't work.
From
[color=red][b][u][i][color=black] ~P K J00~ ------2k6[br][size=1]Posted at: December 18, 2006, 01:45:17 PM[/size][hr]Come on help meh please

item.title: Very important...please help me
item.dc:creator: @Mrquarter Mrquarter
item.description:
@Mrquarter wrote:

You don’t plug your internet into the port hole. You have to plug it into an internet outlet on the wall.

Read full topic

item.title: Very important...please help me

item.description:
@Informer wrote:

Well thats your internet connection it is impossible for us to help with that…it is the internet you have losing connection bc of pits in the wires that sink the connection.we cannot do anything about that sorry.

item.title: Very important...please help me
item.dc:creator: @p_k_j00 p k j00
item.description:
@p_k_j00 wrote:

that didnt help at all because… im not trying to host a server i gave up on that along tie ago im merely trying to get internet to work by plugging it in, in the port (hole) in the back of my router.

Read full topic

item.title: Very important...please help me
item.dc:creator: @Mrquarter Mrquarter
item.description:
@Mrquarter wrote:

Yes, and also if you are running a server, there is major lag due to wireless. And you cannot plug into a port, you have to open a port. And if you mean an internet plug in the wall, make sure it is active.

Read full topic

I have a linksys WAG54g and the wireless network is working perfectly.

The desktop computer is plugged into one of the physical ports.

When I plug a laptop into a physical port. The laptop displays …Connecting, allocating an ip address. then Network cable unplugged.

The router has allocated an ip address.

It doesnt matter what port the desktop pc is plugged into - it works.

It doesnt matter what port the laptop is plugged into - it doesn’t work.
